title: Isolating the Expression
text: First, isolate the absolute value expression. For example, if the problem were $$3|x|-2=6$$, first add two to both sides for the equation, and then divide both sides by 3 to turn it into into $$|x|=\frac{8}{3}$$.

title: Writing Equivalent Expressions
text: Write the equivalent expressions since the expression inside the absolute value could be either negative or positive. For example, if the equation were $$|x|=4$$, the two equations would be $$x=4$$ or $$x=-4$$.

title: Solving Each Equation
text: Solve each equation for the value of x.

title: Checking Each Solution
text: Check each solution by subsituting the values of x into the orginal equation.
